title: 1940 Wansbeck by-election
text:
The Wansbeck by-election, 1940 was a <a href="by-election">by-election</a> held in <a href="England">England</a> on 22 July 1940 for the <a href="House%20of%20Commons%20of%20the%20United%20Kingdom">House of Commons</a> <a href="United%20Kingdom%20constituencies">constituency</a> of <a href="Wansbeck%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Wansbeck</a> in <a href="Northumberland">Northumberland</a>.
Vacancy.
The seat became vacant when the <a href="Conservative%20Party%20%28UK%29">Conservative</a> <a href="Member%20of%20Parliament%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Member of Parliament</a> (MP) <a href="Bernard%20Cruddas">Bernard Cruddas</a> <a href="resignation%20from%20the%20British%20House%20of%20Commons">resigned from the House of Commons</a> on 12 July 1940. He had held the seat since the <a href="1931%20United%20Kingdom%20general%20election">1931 general election</a>.
Results.
The Conservative candidate, <a href="Robert%20Scott%20%28Conservative%20politician%29">Robert Scott</a>, was returned unopposed. He represented the constituency until his defeat at the <a href="1945%20United%20Kingdom%20general%20election">1945 general election</a>.
